name: Dehydration
description: Creatures that do not consume adequate water suffer exhaustion from dehydration
trigger: Drinking less than half the required water for a day

ongoing: Creature gains 1 Exhaustion level at the day's end if drinking less than half required water

mitigation: Drink at least half the required water amount to avoid gaining Exhaustion
Carry adequate water supplies during travel
Create water using magic (e.g., Create or Destroy Water spell)

recovery.requirement: Exhaustion caused by dehydration can't be removed until the creature drinks the full amount of water required for a day
recovery.normalRecovery: After drinking full water requirement, Exhaustion can be removed by Long Rest as normal

srdReference.quote: A creature requires an amount of water per day based on its size, as shown in the Water Needs per Day table. A creature that drinks less than half the required water for a day gains 1 Exhaustion level at the day's end. Exhaustion caused by dehydration can't be removed until the creature drinks the full amount of water required for a day.

examples: Traveling through a desert without adequate water
Being stranded at sea without fresh water
Extended dungeon exploration without water supplies
Forced march without rest or water breaks
